comments.body: I think it's an a intention for you to find trial chambers and crafting was meant as a backup
Can't even disable it entirely... I am incredibly infuriated by this.
Use a mod :) #vanillasucks
I do not like being spied on. Chat moderation is one thing, but his is a gross violation of player privacy.
Minecraft was better before Microsoft, and this is a glaring example of why.
All Hail Trackanon aka Microsoft aka Big Brother

Just saw now that you can't completely opt out and that they forcefully opt you in on world related telemetry.

This is grossly unacceptable. There's no reason why it's required for world telemetry to be forcefully uploaded, especially when I play offline half the time. This needs to be changed. If I OPT OUT, I SHOULD BE OPTED OUT, not partially opted out...

If something is wrong with the game, you can bet I'll make a post here, I don't need the client sending data without me knowing when it does so.
I don't think people actually want the report feature at all though, and servers can still send false reports which is part of the concern people have.
I Think Only Your Chat Priviliges Should Be Removed Instead Of Cut Access To Multiplayer

I agree with this idea, if Mojang REALLY wants the chat feature. But otherwise I’d say just remove it all together. This system is just so abuse-able, and no fixes would really change that, cause people would just always find their way around it.

 

I really don’t know why Mojang is making more work for themselves with a system like this when it’s really not needed.
Mojang should add a system were it flags your post before you send it showing you what may be harmful or offensive so that the player can edit before posting.
good

While I do think that the sonic boom should take less damage and knockback the more wool walls the player put between them and the Warden, I don't think it should reduce the damage completely at a certain number of walls, meaning that the player will always take damage no matter what. less damage but damage non the less.

This will help with getting the "How did we get here?" advancement and help the hardcore players as mentioned in the suggestion above, while still keeping the "no cheesing the Warden" thing the snapshot tried to address and give the player some sort of an advantage that they could use without reducing the sneaking aspect of the Warden.

Another idea that I'd be fine with but not so sure I like as much as the one I mentioned above is keeping the mechanic of fully blocking the sonic boom at a certain number of wool walls but giving the warden the ability to destroy wool blocks specifically.
I had the same idea. This should be a thing
i wish mojang listen to you, so mining can be a little less dangerous, with that thing down there im not mining below y12
I think it would be great if the warden's sonic boom would pull you towards him instead of shooting away. as far as the warden can meet the wither from outside
This really should get in minecraft

One thing I've noticed is that Mojang does not really flesh out their additions very well. They just add something but don't try to integrate it thoroughly into old mechanics. Wool blocks should be capable of blocking the wardens SONIC attack. It's sound. If it covers a 9x9 cross section, you can't use it to cheese the warden; just to get away. What would also be nice is if it couldn't smell through walls - that's kinda op.

Milk is already useful, it is used as an antidote to potion effects, which isn't that a good enough reason to make it useful? There already are lots of options of food, I don't think any new food is coming out for a bit except for glow berries. Plus, there are also food only found in the nether. I don't feel like pineapples and lettuce go with the style of minecraft. There are multiple types of seeds, like wheat seeds, beetroot seeds, pumpkin seeds, and also, many types of saplings. There is already enough about farming in minecraft.
Yes! The freezing damage is way too slow and this might actually make people wear leather. Because before you wouldn't really even care if you fell in because its going to take you 10 minutes to die.
I don't know about the gravity, though. people were really excited about being able to make rooms under it, and if it has gravity, that won't work. other than that, good post, though!

To be fair, you can support a gravity-affected block with a sign, ladder, or open trapdoor. Giving powdered snow gravity would give it utility for traps, as you could freeze your attackers from above with a hidden compartment full of snow.
Cobwebs take a long time to break, powder snow should be the same. Or like water you can only get out of the place that you don't want it to be with a bucket or placing a block in his place.
Totally agree! This idea applied to quicksand for deserts is an appealing feature that I think could be discussed.
I love the look of the mud right at the waterline in swamps! Fits the aesthetic perfectly - this would be great :D

It would also make sense to turn any and all Dirt blocks that are COMPLETELY submerged in water into Mud. Same way coral dies if it is not touching water, but for mud it's the opposite. Maybe mud can turn back into dirt if you dry it out with a nearby fire. (Or the Nether)

Yes, absolutely. Mud instead of dirt at the bottom of bodies of water and on the same level as the water makes perfect sense, to the point where I had originally come here to make this suggestion myself.

If it is in all rivers/lakes there may need to be a grassy mud block to better blend grassy shore lines.

Basically it is a grass block with mud replacing the dirt texture.
not al dirt need to be mud but partly

I had the same problem. I dug a strip at y 32 with iron picks. Cut through around 100 blocks and only found one blob of iron. All that effort and I had barely recovered the cost of my pickaxes. It seems they attempted to balance the low spawn rate by making fortune work on iron. However, the low spawn rate mainly hurts the player in the early game, and since an early game player isn't likely to have enhanced gear, fortune does nothing to affect the balance.

The linear fall-off of resource distribution makes caving a very inefficient way to get iron. If the cave changes elevation even slightly you will see significantly less iron. Having a peak in the distribution means strip mining at y32 is the best way to get iron. This once again punishes early game mining. In the past, an early game player would explore caves, gather resources, and then transition into strip mining once they had a good enough pickaxe.

It feels like there is a huge barrier in the early game. You have to be super careful otherwise you could easily get stuck in a loop where you use resources quicker than you can obtain them. Trapping you in the early game.

Yes! Agreed! The world generation in 1.18 snapshots has turned the underground into swiss cheese. There is now too much negative space, filled with air or water. Continents and islands are "floating" on large open spaces full of air and water, supported by narrow columns of rock. That would be silly enough, but all of this negative space is full of air or water and not useful materials LIKE IRON. The game came out of Infiniminer. The idea was that you could just tunnel in any direction and find enough iron to keep you in tools to keep going, if that's what you wanted to do. After 1.18 you cannot dig a 2x2 block tunnel in any direction for more than 100 meters without running into a large empty space. This is too much empty space, or worse, flooded space. It's hard to build anything underground or make a straight tunnel or stairway down. There are too many caves. The game is MINEcraft not SPELUNKcraft. The game's strength is in its adaptability and flexibility. Not everybody wants to spend all of their time doing nothing but cave crawling. You can make fewer caves and still satisfy the cave exploration people. A survival player should not have to walk (or boat) a couple hundred kilometers just to find a mountain with some iron in it, not to mention the problem of transporting the iron back to another biome where the player may have built a house or other features. This slows the game way down. The idea is to enhance survival mode, not make it unrecognizable.

I'm having the same problem! The other day in cliffs and caves experimental, I was in the truly bizarre situation of having way more diamonds than iron! I now do not use iron for more than one singular pickaxe to obtain diamond, and then I have to switch to diamond tools so as not to waste iron (but I still use stone tier tools for what does not require iron or better to mine). Please sort this out, Iron should be rarer than coal and copper, but more common than the other ores. What is supposed to be the new ideal level for iron? I ask because it used to be more or less uniformly distributed at all levels, with a guarantee of finding enough regardless of the level you were at.

 

I'm on bedrock edition though, I only just realized this threat was for Java!
Iron availability being a function of your proximity to mountains is bad design.  Players shouldn't be required to cross multiple biomes to obtain a necessary resource.

I understand that it may look jarring at first sight but I totally disagree. We now have a more interesting to look at and bigger variety of textures. Sure, you could argue some of them could use some tweaking but hey, that's what the snapshots are for.

People said the same about the texture changes in 1.14, I believe the new textures are an improvement! I've been playing since beta, and while the old textures are nostalgic, the new textures are very nice. Much like with the textures in 1.14, Mojang will probably add a resource pack that replaces the new textures with the old.

While I wouldn't be so rude about it, I do agree. Maybe it's the fact that I'm used to the old textures? Anyway, maybe you guys could add an accessability setting to switch between the textures? You're doing a great job with this game!
The old textures are still in the programmer art texture pack
Оставьте старые текстуры, без них майкнрафт - не майнкрафт!
Please GIVE OLD TEXTURES
the old ore is SOOOOOOO much better please don't change it people will just get a texture pack to make it normal.

honestly I really like the new textures, especially since those that are colorblind have difficulty figuring out which one is what. But the iron texture (21w08a) looks really out of place in my opinion, I like the previous one (21w07a)

The gold one I feel needs more adjustment, I like that it was trying to look like the nether gold in 21w07a, although I feel it should look a little more similar to that some more though, (not exactly the same, but still a bit more similar)

But yea the other textures look awesome! the new copper and emerald ores look the best!!
They Where Changed Due to Colorblindness
yes i agree the new textures are really ugly
and hopefully candles can still float because that's just amazing
And maybe when the player kill or confine a villager, guard villager try to kill a player.
Maybe not attack each other, but I love the idea of defined cultures in each village by the use of a banner

I like the idea of unique banners for villages, but I'm not fond of the idea of guard villagers for two reasons:

1.) Iron golems already guard villages.

2.) Their addition would make raids extremely easy, ruining the entire point of the advancement, "hero of the village" because you could just sit back and let the guards do the work for you.
So all villages haven't guard villager. If they have guard villager, we can't make raids, too much scared. And Iron golems, I think it's like a ravager.
I love this idea it would be a low cooler if there was a village clan

Although I don't think this was ever stated as a design principle by the dev team publicly, I do think there's a reason why they haven't added items that just expand inventory slots. We've seen them add bundles and shulker boxes and ender chests, but never anything that just directly expanded inventory space. I can't say that I know the reasoning behind this, but it is apparent.

Yes please!  A way to have 9 more quickly accessible inventory slots will make the game vastly less limiting.  I find if I go mining or exploring I have 27 slots filled before I start.  The next 9 quickly are filled with stones and ores and smelted ores and compressed those.  And then I need to drop a chest and leave inventory behind all the time, and make multiple trips just to move it all to the surface.  9 more will much more than double the time before things get clogged up.

I think this would make sense, add a new square on the character GUI for capes and Backpacks (pick one or the other for that slot) and the upgrades would expand the player inventory, even if additions are small, say 3 slots per upgrade, it would make it more valuable than a bundle which is causing cross-platform issues. You could have a similar armor progression of the upgrades and it doesn't cross over into other storage ideas. leather 3 slots, iron 6 slots, gold 9 slots, diamond 12 slots, netherite 15 slots. having more Player inventory keeps sulkers valuable to expand especially with the increase number of items in the game.
Yes, please, we need a larger inventory, even a slightly larger one. Micromanagement is fun until it's no longer.
I honestly like the new glass like it is. it is a nice technical feature, and shouldnt be much more than that.

Ok other than being able to be broken without silk touch and making it seeable but dark what else is its purpose? Like making it to see invisible players/ mobs what else is a big no like we need a better use for it like maybe blast proof maybe or hostile mobs can see through  it?

That would honestly be epic for a hidden base. Imagine being hidden inside a mountain. No light would escape from your base AND you would be able to see players trying to sneak up on you if they are invisible
I had the same idea for the amber! Can you plz make tools with it mojang? Please? Hoes, swords, shovels, axes, pickaxes, armor????

Yeah thats a good idea to be able to craft it with breeze rods! Lose all the potato stuff, call it a floater, or some other better name...

However, if they really wanted to keep the clouds from the potato dimension, and in a major future update add all this cool new cloud stuff, they could make a biome which contains these cloud blocks near the height limit, so the crafting recipe would include clouds and breeze rods maybe. Thats just one idea though.

Orrrrr, they add a brand new non-potato sky dimension to the game with the clouds and new items like the potato leash thingy (cough aether cough), but this is a big ask. Your idea is good, they could add it with the trial chamber stuff!
Floatator is very cool. :)
I just saw this on a YouTube comment! Its such a small change but something I'd love to see
Minecraft Legends Reference??

Honestly datapacks are surprisingly lackluster in a lot of ways... there are probably ways to do this, (ie. constantly teleporting the entity to give it the illusion of using the desired AI...) but it would be easier (and smoother, and cause less lag) to just make a mod...

I hope they make datapacks more versatile in the future so that entities behavior, among other things, can be changed...

It really makes sense, they would need heat from their mothers, which dont exist when you're first hatching one of them, so the magma fits very well, or the moss block could be kept since they already grow faster on them, also it would be good to keep the eggs as decorations!
Here is the solution to the backlash crisis that Mojang Studios just got itself into.

Agreed. This feature won't fix the horrendous communication Mojang has shown, or the privacy concerns of chat reporting, but it would fix a significant part of my personal problems with this system and would be a decent step towards tackling the system's other issues. +1

Now, if only Mojang listened to feedback...

*loads into a server*
*message on the server screen appears*
"Warning: This server allows unlawful users. Be advised that content you see here might not be appropriate for all ages"
I don't like the idea of flagging people at all, but I would rather this than having my account outright banned.
Good idea, this is the best of both worlds. If there's anything Mojang/Microsoft REALLY should listen to, this is it.

I agree with this. Platforms for tracking bad actors have been around for ever MC Bans being one of the largest but even here it is up to the private server admins whether or not to use or enforce third party ban lists. I would argue that Microsoft has every right to globally ban accounts that violate TOS "ON REALMS SERVERS"! or servers OWNED by M$. I argue that Microsoft DOES NOT HAVE A RIGHT to globally ban accounts where private servers are concerned. I have no issue with Microsoft publishing a global ban list that servers can utilize however this should be optional whether or not a server enforces it. Although frankly its a moot point given moders have already created server plugins to strip out chat reporting and modded servers can require specific clients with the functionality removed in order to join the only real issue is when someone gets banned on a realms server
please put harcore in minecraft bedrock
Hola

Yes this feature should definately be added

  • It makes sense with the Minecraft lore, after all there is no reason that a naturally created shrieker shouldn't spawn a warden.
  • The new Pale Garden is being added to Minecraft. The player can steal The Creaking's Heart and summon The Creaking wherever the player desires so it feels strange how you can't do something similar with the warden.
  • It makes sense that shriekers have such a low probability of being created by a catalyst since the warden is so powerful. However catalyst-spawned-shriekers don't do anything more than the shriekers that the player can collect in the deep dark so the low probability of them spawning doesn't make much sense.
  • Having shrieker-spawned-catalysts would add some risk to aquiring sensors through sculk catalysts.

Personally me and my friends wanted to defeat the three hardest creatures in Minecraft at the same time and to do so we would have to summon The Wither and The Warden in The End so we were crushed when we found out this couldn't be done without cheats.

I'd like to point out too this is not the entirety of the mechanic, only what was allowed for me to post here. Not sure why the other part was removed, so I'll put it as a comment (only optional part) here.

 

The idea was to use Echo Shards too, as in they stored the sound whilst goat horns were the means for the players to play them. This concept originated from the Echo Shard's own name - as in, "echo" reminded me of perpetuating sound, and thus being able to store different things inside it. Who knows what it's actually storing when found in ancient cities though.

 

Anyhow, while being held in the off-hand, my idea was for the echo shard to pick up the nearest sound effect to it every of seconds. It would make for a dynamic system with it's own new challenges to store some different sounds - how would you get the thunder sfx, for example? There's always rain! But it's possible.

 

An echo shard combined with a goat horn would put the echo shard's sound effect inside the goat horn - thus it'll make that sound once played. This should not, imho, consume the echo shard. It should still have it's current sound effect after that and such could be overwritten using the system of the above paragraph. Making one echo shard alone pretty valuable, although more than one could very often come in handy.

 

I would put concept art/images here, but my suspicions are that this is what got my other post removed. So I hope this is enough for descriptions.

Unlike the other maps, this can be a rare drop from any illager with a flag.

While I think this would be cool, I think that having it sold from villagers like the woodland mansion map and ocean monument map would be just fine.
I think this map might not be a drop, but might be loot in woodland mancions or pillager outposts.

I'm not sure how to reply to comments, but responding to Registered User's comment, perhaps a tag for a spawner's range of effect, and range of player detection that could be added then if one wants to go that route? I think the advantage of using the natural spawn system is that one doesn't need to put spawners everywhere.
This is a fantastic idea!
I like the idea of a mob head like the dragons to collect and have above a fireplace!
I like it but instead of being killed by a creeper, the warden should disappear/leave before the explosion and leave a head behind.

Yeah it would be a simple addition they could throw in now.
Currently its impossible to replant a jungle. After a while you run out of saplings.
